intro: Amsinckia parviflora, commonly known as the smallflower pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its small, yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and the plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in arid conditions. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
